title: 107_s2449
content: The Act titled "Federal Responsibility for Immigrant Health Act of 2002" allows federal payments under Medicaid for emergency medical conditions of certain aliens. The Social Security Act is amended to include necessary care and services for emergency medical conditions, pregnancy-related services, and communicable disease testing or treatment for certain aliens. Additionally, states have the option to eliminate residency requirements for these aliens under Medicaid. Aliens granted parole or admitted as nonimmigrant aliens may be exempt from residency requirements under the State plan for medical assistance. These amendments apply to medical assistance provided after the enactment of the Act. Funding for emergency health services for undocumented aliens is addressed in Section 3. Funding for emergency health services for undocumented aliens is addressed in Section 3. Section 4723 of the Balanced Budget Act of 1997 is amended to allocate $25,000,000 for fiscal years 1998 through 2001 and $50,000,000 for fiscal years 2003 through 2007 for payments to certain States. The determination of State allotments is also modified to include new provisions. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will calculate allotments for the 15 States with the highest percentage of undocumented aliens for fiscal years 2003-2007. The allotment for each State will be based on the ratio of undocumented aliens in the State compared to the total for all States. Any unspent allotment will carry over to the next fiscal year. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will calculate allotments for States with the highest percentage of undocumented aliens for fiscal years 2003-2007. The allotment for each State will be based on the ratio of undocumented aliens in the State compared to the total for all States. Any unspent allotment will carry over to the next fiscal year. Additionally, funds will be used to assist hospitals and providers of emergency health services to undocumented aliens. The State plan will allocate funds to hospitals and providers of emergency health services for undocumented aliens in areas impacted by health costs related to them. Payments will be based on each eligible hospital's payments for emergency medical services under the approved State plan or an alternative proxy for measuring the volume of emergency health services. The subsection defines hospitals and providers eligible to receive funds for emergency health services provided to undocumented aliens. Providers include physicians, healthcare professionals, and entities offering emergency ambulance services. Providers related to hospitals are those furnishing emergency health services to the same individuals. The subsection specifies that funds for emergency health services provided to undocumented aliens shall not substitute federal payments made to reimburse states for such services under the Social Security Act. The amendments made by this section will be effective starting fiscal year 2003. SEC. 4. Permitting states and localities to provide health care to all individuals. Section 411 of the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 is amended to exclude health benefits provided to individuals from the definition of "assistance." The amendments exclude health benefits from the definition of "assistance" provided by a State or local government agency or appropriated funds. The changes apply to health care provided before, on, or after the enactment of the Act.
